channel.title: Ktorrent problem
channel.description:
as I said in another topic, I have a Ktorrent problem(crashes every once in a while)
here is the data on it: signal 11:SIGSEGV available backtrace: #6 0xb7e64bcb in dht::ParseRsp () from /usr/lib/libktorrent-2.1.so #7 0xb7e64df2 in dht::MakeRPCMsg () from /usr/lib/libktorrent-2.1.so #8 0xb7e59f51 in dht::RPCServer::readPacket () from /usr/lib/libktorrent-2.1.so #9 0xb7e5a252 in dht::RPCServer::qt_invoke () from /usr/lib/libktorrent-2.1.so #10 0xb6e9e88b in QObject::activate_signal () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #11 0xb6e9f330 in QObject::activate_signal () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #12 0xb762802c in KNetwork::KClientSocketBase::readyRead () from /usr/lib/libkdecore.so.4 #13 0xb7628066 in KNetwork::KClientSocketBase::slotReadActivity () from /usr/lib/libkdecore.so.4 #14 0xb763a123 in KNetwork::KClientSocketBase::qt_invoke () from /usr/lib/libkdecore.so.4 #15 0xb763a1c6 in KNetwork::KDatagramSocket::qt_invoke () from /usr/lib/libkdecore.so.4 #16 0xb6e9e88b in QObject::activate_signal () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #17 0xb6e9f1a2 in QObject::activate_signal () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #18 0xb722b547 in QSocketNotifier::activated () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #19 0xb6ec144a in QSocketNotifier::event () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #20 0xb6e35a60 in QApplication::internalNotify () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #21 0xb6e3788f in QApplication::notify () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #22 0xb75f9cc2 in KApplication::notify () from /usr/lib/libkdecore.so.4 #23 0xb6dc81e9 in QApplication::sendEvent () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #24 0xb6e27e59 in QEventLoop::activateSocketNotifiers () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #25 0xb6ddcd07 in QEventLoop::processEvents () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #26 0xb6e50136 in QEventLoop::enterLoop () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #27 0xb6e4ff46 in QEventLoop::exec () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #28 0xb6e37609 in QApplication::exec () from /usr/lib/libqt-mt.so.3 #29 0x080653d6 in ?? () #30 0xb664febc in __libc_start_main () from /lib/tls/i686/cmov/libc.so.6 #31 0x08064ec1 in ?? ()
is that enough information? It usually crashes without any of my involvement for about 30 mins to some random time

item.title: Ktorrent problem
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

odd, I use ktorrent and have never seen it crash at all. I would say try removing it and reinstalling it. I see a lot of libqt problems. Maybe you updated qt and not kde or the other way around or ktorrent needs one of those updated? Not exactly sure, but that would be a good start.

Read full topic

item.title: Ktorrent problem
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:

as I said in another topic, I have a Ktorrent problem(crashes every once in a while)

here is the data on it: signal 11:SIGSEGV
